snippet: The Obama administration is seeking to deploy the vast new supply of natural gas in the United States as a weapon to undercut the influence of President Vladimir V. Putin.
abstract: Crisis in the Ukraine is accelerating State Department initiative to use America's booming natural gas supply to subvert influence of Russian Pres Vladimir V Putin; Russia supplies 60 percent of Ukraine’s natural gas and has a history of cutting off supply during conflicts; Obama administration's strategy to undercut Russian natural gas sales to Ukraine and Europe is drawing support from Republicans and oil industry.

byline.original: By CORAL DAVENPORT and STEVEN ERLANGER
byline.contributor: Coral Davenport reported from Washington, and Steven Erlanger from Kiev, Ukraine. Andrew E. Kramer contributed reporting from Kiev.

lead_paragraph: The Obama administration is seeking to deploy the vast new supply of natural gas in the United States as a weapon to undercut the influence of President Vladimir V. Putin.

headline.main: U.S. Hopes Boom in Natural Gas Can Curb Putin
headline.print_headline: U.S. Hopes Boom in Natural Gas Can Curb Putin
